title: Net ionic equation - AlCl3 and NaOH

content.description: <math alttext="A l C l 3 aqueous plus 3 N a O H aqueous, react to produce A l, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 3 solid, plus 3 N a C l aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AlCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>OH</mtext><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Which of the following is the balanced net ionic equation for the reaction represented by the preceeding equation?

choices.label: <math alttext="A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce A l, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus 3 O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce A l, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous plus 3 C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous, plus 3 N a O H aqueous, react to produce A l, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 3 solid, plus 3 N a with a positive 1 charge aqueous, plus 3 C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="A l with a positive 3 charge aqueous, plus 3 C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous, plus 3 N a with a positive 1 charge aqueous, plus 3 O H with a negative 1 charge aqueous, react to produce A l, open parenthesis, O H, close parenthesis, 3 solid, plus 3 N a with a positive 1 charge aqueous, plus 3 C l with a negative 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>OH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(OH)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>Na</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
